sqlServer.name: sqlServer

revisions.description: Added entries to support multiple instances of installed SQL Server. Also added counters for SQL Server 2005.
Changed the syntax of the datapoints from integer to gauge.
The initial revision of this MIB module.

sqlServer.contactinfo: Garth Williams 11135-23A Ave Edmonton, AB T6J4W5 Canada Tel: +1 780 434 4113 E-mail: garth.williams@wtcs.org
sqlServer.description: The MIB module for SNMP Informant SQLServer performance counter entries.

analysisServerAggCache.name: analysisServerAggCache
analysisServerAggCache.description: The Agg Cache object counters provide information about the aggregation cache.

asacBytesAddedPerSec.name: asacBytesAddedPerSec
asacBytesAddedPerSec.description: Rate of bytes added to the cache.

asacCurrentBytes.name: asacCurrentBytes
asacCurrentBytes.description: Current number of bytes used by the aggregation cache.

asacDirectHitRatio.name: asacDirectHitRatio
asacDirectHitRatio.description: Ratio of cache direct hits to cache lookups, for the period between obtaining counter values.

asacDirectHitsPerSec.name: asacDirectHitsPerSec
asacDirectHitsPerSec.description: Rate of cache direct hits. Queries were answered from an existing cache entry.

asacEvictionsPerSec.name: asacEvictionsPerSec
asacEvictionsPerSec.description: Rate of evictions from the cache. This is per partition per cube per database. Typically due to background cleaner.

asacFilterHitRatio.name: asacFilterHitRatio
asacFilterHitRatio.description: Ratio of cache filter hits to cache lookups, for the period between obtaining counter values.

asacFilterHitsPerSec.name: asacFilterHitsPerSec
asacFilterHitsPerSec.description: Rate of cache filter hits. Queries were answered by filtering an existing cache entry.

asacInsertsPerSec.name: asacInsertsPerSec
asacInsertsPerSec.description: Rate of insertions into the cache. This is per partition per cube per database.

asacTotalDirectHits.name: asacTotalDirectHits
asacTotalDirectHits.description: Total count of direct cache hits. Queries were answered from existing cache entries.

asacTotalEvictions.name: asacTotalEvictions
asacTotalEvictions.description: Evictions from the cache. This is per partition per cube per database. Typically due to background cleaner.

asacTotalFilterHits.name: asacTotalFilterHits
asacTotalFilterHits.description: Total count of filter cache hits. Queries were answered by filtering existing cache entries.

asacTotalInserts.name: asacTotalInserts
asacTotalInserts.description: Insertions into the cache. This is per partition per cube per database.

asacTotalLookups.name: asacTotalLookups
asacTotalLookups.description: Total number of lookups into the cache. Note that each MDX query has zero or more server round trips, and each partition will be queried.

analysisServerConnection.name: analysisServerConnection
analysisServerConnection.description: The Connection object counters provide information about server activity in general. They can be used to monitor the performance of user connections with Analysis Services.

ascCompletionsPerSec.name: ascCompletionsPerSec
ascCompletionsPerSec.description: Rate of connection completions. This includes successful and failed connection attempts.

ascCurrentAgents.name: ascCurrentAgents
ascCurrentAgents.description: Current number of agents on server.

ascCurrentAuthentications.name: ascCurrentAuthentications
ascCurrentAuthentications.description: Current number of authentications in progress.

ascCurrentConnections.name: ascCurrentConnections
ascCurrentConnections.description: Current number of client connections established.

ascCurrentConnectionsInProgress.name: ascCurrentConnectionsInProgress
ascCurrentConnectionsInProgress.description: Current number of connections pending completion.

ascCurrentHttpConnections.name: ascCurrentHttpConnections
ascCurrentHttpConnections.description: Current number of http connections established.

ascRequestsPerSec.name: ascRequestsPerSec
ascRequestsPerSec.description: Rate of connection requests. These are arrivals.

ascTotalRequests.name: ascTotalRequests
ascTotalRequests.description: Total connection requests. These are arrivals.

analysisServerLastQuery.name: analysisServerLastQuery
analysisServerLastQuery.description: The Last Query object counters provide information about processing on the last query.

aslqAnswerFromCacheDirect.name: aslqAnswerFromCacheDirect
aslqAnswerFromCacheDirect.description: Number of partitions answered directly from cache.

aslqAnswerFromCacheFiltered.name: aslqAnswerFromCacheFiltered
aslqAnswerFromCacheFiltered.description: Number of partitions answered by filtering from other cache entries.

aslqAnswerFromFile.name: aslqAnswerFromFile
aslqAnswerFromFile.description: Number of partitions answered from files.

aslqDSNRequested.name: aslqDSNRequested
aslqDSNRequested.description: Data Set Name requested as the query to the server. (Levels used for each dimension.)

aslqDSNUsed.name: aslqDSNUsed
aslqDSNUsed.description: Data Set Name used to answer the query. (Levels used for each dimension.)

aslqDataAvgBytesPerRead.name: aslqDataAvgBytesPerRead
aslqDataAvgBytesPerRead.description: Average bytes per data file read operation.

aslqDataAvgRowsPerRead.name: aslqDataAvgRowsPerRead
aslqDataAvgRowsPerRead.description: Average num rows read per data file read operation.

aslqDataBytes.name: aslqDataBytes
aslqDataBytes.description: Bytes read from the Data file.

aslqDataReads.name: aslqDataReads
aslqDataReads.description: Number of logical read operations using the Data file.

aslqIndexBytes.name: aslqIndexBytes
aslqIndexBytes.description: Bytes read from the Index file.

aslqIndexReads.name: aslqIndexReads
aslqIndexReads.description: Number of logical read operations using the Index file.

aslqMapBytes.name: aslqMapBytes
aslqMapBytes.description: Bytes read from the Map file.

aslqMapReads.name: aslqMapReads
aslqMapReads.description: Number of logical read operations using the Map file.

aslqQueryNum.name: aslqQueryNum
aslqQueryNum.description: Monotonically increasing query count. Might be useful for tools to check which query this information applies to.

aslqRowsCreated.name: aslqRowsCreated
aslqRowsCreated.description: Number of rows created, which forms the final answer in the aggregation set.

aslqRowsFilterExcluded.name: aslqRowsFilterExcluded
aslqRowsFilterExcluded.description: Number of rows which were excluded by filtering.

aslqRowsFilterIncluded.name: aslqRowsFilterIncluded
aslqRowsFilterIncluded.description: Number of rows which were included by filtering.

aslqRowsFiltered.name: aslqRowsFiltered
aslqRowsFiltered.description: Number of rows against which a filtering operation was applied.

aslqRowsRead.name: aslqRowsRead
aslqRowsRead.description: Number of rows read from disk or from the aggregation cache (in memory).

aslqTotalReads.name: aslqTotalReads
aslqTotalReads.description: Number of logical read operations for all files.

analysisServerLocks.name: analysisServerLocks
analysisServerLocks.description: The Locks object counters provide information about latching and locking activity. They can be used to monitor the performance of latches and locks with Analysis Services.

aslCurrentLatchWaits.name: aslCurrentLatchWaits
aslCurrentLatchWaits.description: Current number of threads waiting for a latch. These are latch requests that could not be given immediate grants and are in a wait state.

aslCurrentLockWaits.name: aslCurrentLockWaits
aslCurrentLockWaits.description: Current number of clients waiting for a lock.

aslLatchWaitsPerSec.name: aslLatchWaitsPerSec
aslLatchWaitsPerSec.description: Rate of latch requests that could not be granted immediately and had to wait before being granted.

aslLockGrantsPerSec.name: aslLockGrantsPerSec
aslLockGrantsPerSec.description: Number of lock grants per second.

aslLockRequestsPerSec.name: aslLockRequestsPerSec
aslLockRequestsPerSec.description: Number of lock requests per second.

aslLockWaitsPerSec.name: aslLockWaitsPerSec
aslLockWaitsPerSec.description: Number of lock waits per second. These are lock requests that could not be given immediate lock grants and were put in a wait state.

aslUnlockRequestsPerSec.name: aslUnlockRequestsPerSec
aslUnlockRequestsPerSec.description: Number of unlock requests per second.

analysisServerProc.name: analysisServerProc
analysisServerProc.description: The Proc object counters provide information about processing data.

aspCurrentPartitions.name: aspCurrentPartitions
aspCurrentPartitions.description: Current number of partitions being processed.

aspCurrentThreads.name: aspCurrentThreads
aspCurrentThreads.description: Current number of threads working on processing.

aspCurrentThreadsMerging.name: aspCurrentThreadsMerging
aspCurrentThreadsMerging.description: Current number of threads merging data. Decremented when blocked by pipeline of work.

aspCurrentThreadsReading.name: aspCurrentThreadsReading
aspCurrentThreadsReading.description: Current number of threads reading source data. Decremented when blocked by pipeline of work.

aspCurrentThreadsWriting.name: aspCurrentThreadsWriting
aspCurrentThreadsWriting.description: Current number of threads writing data to disk. Decremented when blocked by pipeline of work.

aspFileBytesWrittenPerSec.name: aspFileBytesWrittenPerSec
aspFileBytesWrittenPerSec.description: Rate of writing bytes to a MOLAP file.

aspFileRowsWrittenPerSec.name: aspFileRowsWrittenPerSec
aspFileRowsWrittenPerSec.description: Rate of writing rows to a MOLAP file.

aspMemorySizeBytes.name: aspMemorySizeBytes
aspMemorySizeBytes.description: Size of current rows in memory. This count is an estimate.

aspMemorySizeRows.name: aspMemorySizeRows
aspMemorySizeRows.description: Size of current rows in memory. This count is an estimate.

aspRowsCreatedPerSec.name: aspRowsCreatedPerSec
aspRowsCreatedPerSec.description: Rate of aggregation rows created. This will be different than rows read/sec if duplicates exist.

aspRowsMergedPerSec.name: aspRowsMergedPerSec
aspRowsMergedPerSec.description: Rate of rows merged or inserted. Compare with rows/sec.

aspRowsReadPerSec.name: aspRowsReadPerSec
aspRowsReadPerSec.description: Rate of rows read from source database.

aspTotalPartitions.name: aspTotalPartitions
aspTotalPartitions.description: Accumulating count of partitions finished processing. This count is incremented if processing is successful or not.

aspTotalRows.name: aspTotalRows
aspTotalRows.description: Count of rows read from source database.

analysisServerProcAggs.name: analysisServerProcAggs
analysisServerProcAggs.description: The Proc Aggs object counters provide information about processing aggregations.

aspaCurrentPartitions.name: aspaCurrentPartitions
aspaCurrentPartitions.description: Current number of partitions being processed.

aspaMemorySizeBytes.name: aspaMemorySizeBytes
aspaMemorySizeBytes.description: Size of current aggregations in memory. This count is an estimate.

aspaMemorySizeRows.name: aspaMemorySizeRows
aspaMemorySizeRows.description: Size of current aggregations in memory. This count is an estimate.

aspaRowsMergedPerSec.name: aspaRowsMergedPerSec
aspaRowsMergedPerSec.description: Rate of rows merged or inserted into an aggregation.

aspaTempFileBytesWrittenPerSec.name: aspaTempFileBytesWrittenPerSec
aspaTempFileBytesWrittenPerSec.description: Rate of writing bytes to a temporary file. Temporary files are written when aggregations exceed memory limits.

aspaTempFileRowsWrittenPerSec.name: aspaTempFileRowsWrittenPerSec
aspaTempFileRowsWrittenPerSec.description: Rate of writing rows to a temporary file. Temporary files are written when aggregations exceed memory limits.

aspaTotalPartitions.name: aspaTotalPartitions
aspaTotalPartitions.description: Total number of partitions processed (successfully or otherwise).

analysisServerProcIndexes.name: analysisServerProcIndexes
analysisServerProcIndexes.description: The Proc Indexes object counters provide information about processing indexes.

aspiCurrentPartitions.name: aspiCurrentPartitions
aspiCurrentPartitions.description: Current number of partitions being processed.

aspiRowsPerSec.name: aspiRowsPerSec
aspiRowsPerSec.description: Rate of rows from MOLAP files used to create indexes.

aspiTotalPartitions.name: aspiTotalPartitions
aspiTotalPartitions.description: Total number of partitions processed (successfully or otherwise).

aspiTotalRows.name: aspiTotalRows
aspiTotalRows.description: Total rows from MOLAP files used to create indexes.

analysisServerQuery.name: analysisServerQuery
analysisServerQuery.description: The Query object counters provide information about processing on the last query, such as elapsed time in milliseconds of the last query processed.

asqAvgTimePerQuery.name: asqAvgTimePerQuery
asqAvgTimePerQuery.description: Average time per query, in milliseconds. Response time based on queries answered since the last counter measurement.

asqBytesSentPerSec.name: asqBytesSentPerSec
asqBytesSentPerSec.description: Rate of bytes sent by server to clients, in response to queries.

asqCurrentProcessThreadPool.name: asqCurrentProcessThreadPool
asqCurrentProcessThreadPool.description: Count of threads in processing thread pool. These threads resolve queries.

asqCurrentProcessThreadQueueLen.name: asqCurrentProcessThreadQueueLen
asqCurrentProcessThreadQueueLen.description: Current length of queue for processing thread pool work items.

asqCurrentProcessThreadsActive.name: asqCurrentProcessThreadsActive
asqCurrentProcessThreadsActive.description: Current number of process threads actively working on queries.

asqCurrentPyramidOperations.name: asqCurrentPyramidOperations
asqCurrentPyramidOperations.description: Current number of pyramid operations in progress.

asqCurrentQueries.name: asqCurrentQueries
asqCurrentQueries.description: Current number of queries being actively worked on.

asqCurrentThreads.name: asqCurrentThreads
asqCurrentThreads.description: Current number of threads working on queries.

asqCurrentWorkerThreadPool.name: asqCurrentWorkerThreadPool
asqCurrentWorkerThreadPool.description: Count of threads in worker thread pool. These threads answer requests from clients.

asqCurrentWorkerThreadsActive.name: asqCurrentWorkerThreadsActive
asqCurrentWorkerThreadsActive.description: Current number of worker threads active.

asqDataBytesPerSec.name: asqDataBytesPerSec
asqDataBytesPerSec.description: Bytes read from the Data file.

asqDataReadsPerSec.name: asqDataReadsPerSec
asqDataReadsPerSec.description: Number of logical read operations using the Data file.

asqIndexBytesPerSec.name: asqIndexBytesPerSec
asqIndexBytesPerSec.description: Bytes read from the Index file.

asqIndexReadsPerSec.name: asqIndexReadsPerSec
asqIndexReadsPerSec.description: Number of logical read operations using the Index file.

asqMapBytesPerSec.name: asqMapBytesPerSec
asqMapBytesPerSec.description: Bytes read from the Map file.

asqMapReadsPerSec.name: asqMapReadsPerSec
asqMapReadsPerSec.description: Number of logical read operations using the Map file.

asqNetworkRoundTripsPerSec.name: asqNetworkRoundTripsPerSec
asqNetworkRoundTripsPerSec.description: Rate of network round trips. This includes all client/server communication.

asqQueriesFromCacheDirectPerSec.name: asqQueriesFromCacheDirectPerSec
asqQueriesFromCacheDirectPerSec.description: Rate of queries answered from cache directly.

asqQueriesFromCacheFilterPerSec.name: asqQueriesFromCacheFilterPerSec
asqQueriesFromCacheFilterPerSec.description: Rate of queries answered by filtering existing cache entry.

asqQueriesFromFilePerSec.name: asqQueriesFromFilePerSec
asqQueriesFromFilePerSec.description: Rate of queries answered from files.

asqQueriesRequestedPerSec.name: asqQueriesRequestedPerSec
asqQueriesRequestedPerSec.description: Rate of query requests arriving at the server.

asqRowsSentPerSec.name: asqRowsSentPerSec
asqRowsSentPerSec.description: Rate of rows sent by server to clients.

asqTotalBytesSent.name: asqTotalBytesSent
asqTotalBytesSent.description: Total bytes sent by server to clients, in response to queries.

asqTotalNetworkRoundTrips.name: asqTotalNetworkRoundTrips
asqTotalNetworkRoundTrips.description: Total network round trips. This includes all client/server communication.

asqTotalQueriesFromCacheDirect.name: asqTotalQueriesFromCacheDirect
asqTotalQueriesFromCacheDirect.description: Total number of queries derived directly from cache. Note that this is per partition.

asqTotalQueriesFromCacheFiltered.name: asqTotalQueriesFromCacheFiltered
asqTotalQueriesFromCacheFiltered.description: Total queries answered by filtering existing cache entries.

asqTotalQueriesFromFile.name: asqTotalQueriesFromFile
asqTotalQueriesFromFile.description: Total number of queries answered from files.

asqTotalRowsSent.name: asqTotalRowsSent
asqTotalRowsSent.description: Total rows sent by server to clients.

analysisServerQueryDims.name: analysisServerQueryDims
analysisServerQueryDims.description: The Query Dims object counters provide information about processing queries dimensions.

asqdCurrentRequests.name: asqdCurrentRequests
asqdCurrentRequests.description: Current number of requests for part of the member tree or for member properties.

asqdRequestsPerSec.name: asqdRequestsPerSec
asqdRequestsPerSec.description: Rate of requests for part of the member tree or for member properties. Consider increasing Large Level Threshold if this counter is excessive.

asqdTotalVLDMRequests.name: asqdTotalVLDMRequests
asqdTotalVLDMRequests.description: Total VLDM (Very Large Dimension Manager) requests sent.

asqdTotalRequests.name: asqdTotalRequests
asqdTotalRequests.description: Total number of requests for part of the member tree or for member properties.

asqdVLDMRequestsPerSec.name: asqdVLDMRequestsPerSec
asqdVLDMRequestsPerSec.description: Rate of VLDM (Very Large Dimension Manager) requests.

analysisServerStartup.name: analysisServerStartup
analysisServerStartup.description: The Startup object counters provide information about processing startups.

assBytesPerSec.name: assBytesPerSec
assBytesPerSec.description: Rate of bytes read from dimension files.

assTotalBytes.name: assTotalBytes
assTotalBytes.description: Total bytes read from dimension files.

mgAccessingRobotsTxtFile.name: mgAccessingRobotsTxtFile
mgAccessingRobotsTxtFile.description: The number of current requests for robots.txt. Robots.txt is requested by the system implicitly, for every host, through HTTP.

mgActiveQueueLength.name: mgActiveQueueLength
mgActiveQueueLength.description: The number of documents waiting for robot threads. If this number is not 0, all threads should be filtering.

mgAdminClients.name: mgAdminClients
mgAdminClients.description: The number of currently connected administrative clients.

mgAllNotificationsReceived.name: mgAllNotificationsReceived
mgAllNotificationsReceived.description: The total number of notifications received from all notification sources including file system.

mgDelayedDocuments.name: mgDelayedDocuments
mgDelayedDocuments.description: The number of documents delayed due to site hit frequency rules.

mgDocumentEntries.name: mgDocumentEntries
mgDocumentEntries.description: The number of document entries currently in memory. Zero means no indexing activity is going on.

mgDocumentsDelayedRetry.name: mgDocumentsDelayedRetry
mgDocumentsDelayedRetry.description: The number of documents that will be retried after time-out. When this is non-zero, it means that the local server it is crawling is shut down.

mgDocumentsFiltered.name: mgDocumentsFiltered
mgDocumentsFiltered.description: The number of times a filter object was created. This corresponds to the total number of documents filtered in the system since startup.

mgDocumentsFilteredRate.name: mgDocumentsFilteredRate
mgDocumentsFilteredRate.description: The number of documents filtered per second.

mgDocumentsSuccessfullyFiltered.name: mgDocumentsSuccessfullyFiltered
mgDocumentsSuccessfullyFiltered.description: The number of documents successfully filtered.

mgDocumentsSuccessfulFilterRate.name: mgDocumentsSuccessfulFilterRate
mgDocumentsSuccessfulFilterRate.description: The number of successfully filtered documents per second.

mgExtNotificationsRate.name: mgExtNotificationsRate
mgExtNotificationsRate.description: The rate of external notifications received per second.

mgExtNotificationsReceived.name: mgExtNotificationsReceived
mgExtNotificationsReceived.description: The total number of notifications received from all notification sources excluding file system.

mgFilterObjects.name: mgFilterObjects
mgFilterObjects.description: The number of filter objects in the system. Each filter object corresponds to a URL currently being filtered.

mgFilterProcessCreated.name: mgFilterProcessCreated
mgFilterProcessCreated.description: The total number of times a filter process was created or restarted. Having too many filter processes created indicates that filtering is having trouble with the data in the documents.

mgFilterProcesses.name: mgFilterProcesses
mgFilterProcesses.description: The number of filtering processes in the system.

mgFilterProcessesMax.name: mgFilterProcessesMax
mgFilterProcessesMax.description: The maximum number of filtering processes that have existed in the system since startup.

mgFilteringThreads.name: mgFilteringThreads
mgFilteringThreads.description: The total number of filtering threads in the system. This number is calculated based on your system resources.

mgHeartbeats.name: mgHeartbeats
mgHeartbeats.description: The total number of heartbeats counted since startup. A heartbeat occurs once every 10 seconds while the service is running. If the service is not running there will be no heartbeat and the number of ticks will not be incremented.

mgIdleThreads.name: mgIdleThreads
mgIdleThreads.description: The number of threads waiting for documents.

mgNotificationsRate.name: mgNotificationsRate
mgNotificationsRate.description: The rate of external notifications received per second.

mgPerformanceLevel.name: mgPerformanceLevel
mgPerformanceLevel.description: Indicates the level of the amount of system resources that the Gatherer service is allowed to use.

mgReasonToBackOff.name: mgReasonToBackOff
mgReasonToBackOff.description: The code describing why the Gatherer service went into back off state. 0 - up and running 1 - high system IO traffic 2 - high notifications rate 3 - delayed recovery in progress (not implemented) 4 - back off due to user activity 5 - Battery Low 6 - Memory Low 99 - back off for some internal reason (forced by Search itself) While backing off, no indexing is performed. To resume the indexing you must eliminate the reason for back off. If the Gatherer service is in back off state, the Search service is paused and there is a message in the event log.

mgRobotsTxtRequests.name: mgRobotsTxtRequests
mgRobotsTxtRequests.description: The total number of requests for robots.txt.

mgServerObjects.name: mgServerObjects
mgServerObjects.description: The number of servers recently accessed by the system.

mgServerObjectsCreated.name: mgServerObjectsCreated
mgServerObjectsCreated.description: The number of times a new server object had to be created.

mgServersCurrentlyUnavailable.name: mgServersCurrentlyUnavailable
mgServersCurrentlyUnavailable.description: A server becomes unavailable when a number of requests to that server time out.

mgServersUnavailable.name: mgServersUnavailable
mgServersUnavailable.description: A server becomes unavailable when a number of requests to that server time out.

mgStemmersCached.name: mgStemmersCached
mgStemmersCached.description: Number of available cached stemmer instances. Too many may indicate a resource usage problem.

mgSystemIOTrafficRate.name: mgSystemIOTrafficRate
mgSystemIOTrafficRate.description: System IO (disk) traffic rate in KB/s detected by back off logic

mgThreadsAccessingNetwork.name: mgThreadsAccessingNetwork
mgThreadsAccessingNetwork.description: The number of threads waiting for a response from the filter process. If no activity is going on and this number is equal to number of filtering threads, it may indicate a network problem or unavailability of the server it is crawling.

mgThreadsInPlugIns.name: mgThreadsInPlugIns
mgThreadsInPlugIns.description: The number of threads waiting for plug-ins to complete an operation.

mgThreadsBlockedDueToBackOff.name: mgThreadsBlockedDueToBackOff
mgThreadsBlockedDueToBackOff.description: The number of threads blocked due to back off event

mgTimeOuts.name: mgTimeOuts
mgTimeOuts.description: The total number of timeouts detected by the system since startup.

mgWordBreakersCached.name: mgWordBreakersCached
mgWordBreakersCached.description: Number of available cached word breakers instances

microsoftGathererProjectsTable.name: microsoftGathererProjectsTable
microsoftGathererProjectsTable.description: Counters for the Microsoft Gatherer Project object

microsoftGathererProjectsEntry.name: microsoftGathererProjectsEntry
microsoftGathererProjectsEntry.description: Performance information for one particular instance of 'Microsoft Gatherer Projects' object.

mgpAccessedFileRate.name: mgpAccessedFileRate
mgpAccessedFileRate.description: The number of documents accessed via file system per second.

mgpAccessedFiles.name: mgpAccessedFiles
mgpAccessedFiles.description: The number of documents accessed via file system.

mgpAccessedHTTP.name: mgpAccessedHTTP
mgpAccessedHTTP.description: The number of documents accessed via HTTP.

mgpAccessedHTTPRate.name: mgpAccessedHTTPRate
mgpAccessedHTTPRate.description: The number of documents accessed via HTTP per second.

mgpAdaptiveCrawlErrors.name: mgpAdaptiveCrawlErrors
mgpAdaptiveCrawlErrors.description: Documents incorrectly rejected by adaptive crawl

mgpAdaptiveCrawlFalsePositives.name: mgpAdaptiveCrawlFalsePositives
mgpAdaptiveCrawlFalsePositives.description: Documents incorrectly accepted by adaptive crawl

mgpAdaptiveCrawlTotal.name: mgpAdaptiveCrawlTotal
mgpAdaptiveCrawlTotal.description: Documents to which adaptive crawl logic was applied

mgpDelayedDocuments.name: mgpDelayedDocuments
mgpDelayedDocuments.description: The number of documents delayed due to site hit frequency rules.

mgpDocumentAddRate.name: mgpDocumentAddRate
mgpDocumentAddRate.description: The number of document additions per second.

mgpDocumentDeleteRate.name: mgpDocumentDeleteRate
mgpDocumentDeleteRate.description: The number of document deletes per second.

mgpDocumentModifiesRate.name: mgpDocumentModifiesRate
mgpDocumentModifiesRate.description: The number of modify notifications per second.

mgpDocumentMoveAndRenameRate.name: mgpDocumentMoveAndRenameRate
mgpDocumentMoveAndRenameRate.description: The number of document Moves and Renames per second.

mgpDocumentsInProgress.name: mgpDocumentsInProgress
mgpDocumentsInProgress.description: The number of documents in progress.

mgpDocumentsOnHold.name: mgpDocumentsOnHold
mgpDocumentsOnHold.description: The number of documents on hold because a document with the same URL is currently in process.

mgpErrorRate.name: mgpErrorRate
mgpErrorRate.description: The number of filtered documents which returned an error per second.

mgpFileErrors.name: mgpFileErrors
mgpFileErrors.description: The number of file protocol errors received while getting documents.

mgpFileErrorsRate.name: mgpFileErrorsRate
mgpFileErrorsRate.description: The number of file protocol errors received per second.

mgpFilteredHTML.name: mgpFilteredHTML
mgpFilteredHTML.description: The number of HTML documents filtered.

mgpFilteredHTMLRate.name: mgpFilteredHTMLRate
mgpFilteredHTMLRate.description: The number of HTML documents filtered per second.

mgpFilteredOffice.name: mgpFilteredOffice
mgpFilteredOffice.description: The number of office documents filtered.

mgpFilteredOfficeRate.name: mgpFilteredOfficeRate
mgpFilteredOfficeRate.description: The number of office documents filtered per second.

mgpFilteredText.name: mgpFilteredText
mgpFilteredText.description: The number of text documents filtered.

mgpFilteredTextRate.name: mgpFilteredTextRate
mgpFilteredTextRate.description: The number of text documents filtered per second.

mgpFilteringDocuments.name: mgpFilteringDocuments
mgpFilteringDocuments.description: The number of documents currently being filtered.

mgpGathererPausedFlag.name: mgpGathererPausedFlag
mgpGathererPausedFlag.description: The Gatherer paused flag indicates if the Gatherer has been paused.

mgpHTTPErrors.name: mgpHTTPErrors
mgpHTTPErrors.description: The number of HTTP errors received.

mgpHTTPErrorsRate.name: mgpHTTPErrorsRate
mgpHTTPErrorsRate.description: The number of HTTP errors received per second

mgpHistoryRecoveryProgress.name: mgpHistoryRecoveryProgress
mgpHistoryRecoveryProgress.description: Percentage of the history recovery completed

mgpIterateHistoryInProgressFlag.name: mgpIterateHistoryInProgressFlag
mgpIterateHistoryInProgressFlag.description: The Iterating history in progress flag indicates if the Gatherer is currently iterating over the URL history.

mgpNotModified.name: mgpNotModified
mgpNotModified.description: The number of documents which were not filtered because no modification was detected since the last crawl.

mgpProcessedDocuments.name: mgpProcessedDocuments
mgpProcessedDocuments.description: The number of documents processed since the history has been reset.

mgpProcessedDocumentsRate.name: mgpProcessedDocumentsRate
mgpProcessedDocumentsRate.description: The number of documents processed per second.

mgpRecoveryInProgressFlag.name: mgpRecoveryInProgressFlag
mgpRecoveryInProgressFlag.description: The Recovery in progress flag indicates if recovery is currently in progress.

mgpRetries.name: mgpRetries
mgpRetries.description: The total number of times a document access has been retried.

mgpRetriesRate.name: mgpRetriesRate
mgpRetriesRate.description: The number of retries per second.

mgpStartedDocuments.name: mgpStartedDocuments
mgpStartedDocuments.description: The number of documents initiated into the Gatherer service. This includes the number of documents on hold, in the active queue, and currently filtered.

mgpStatusError.name: mgpStatusError
mgpStatusError.description: The number of filtered documents which returned an error.

mgpStatusSuccess.name: mgpStatusSuccess
mgpStatusSuccess.description: The number of successfully filtered documents.

mgpSuccessRate.name: mgpSuccessRate
mgpSuccessRate.description: The number of successfully filtered documents per second.

mgpURLsInHistory.name: mgpURLsInHistory
mgpURLsInHistory.description: The number of files (URLs) in the history list.

mgpUniqueDocuments.name: mgpUniqueDocuments
mgpUniqueDocuments.description: Number of unique documents in the system. Documents are considered not unique if their contents is the same.

mgpWaitingDocuments.name: mgpWaitingDocuments
mgpWaitingDocuments.description: The number of documents waiting to be processed.

microsoftSearch.name: microsoftSearch
microsoftSearch.description: Global counters in the Microsoft search service.

sqlServerAccessMethodsTable.name: sqlServerAccessMethodsTable
sqlServerAccessMethodsTable.description: The Access Methods object in Microsoft SQL Server provides counters to monitor how the logical pages within the database are accessed. Physical access to the database pages on disk is monitored using the Buffer Manager counters. Monitoring the methods used to access database pages can help you to determine whether query performance can be improved by adding or modifying indexes or by rewriting queries. The Access Methods counters can also be used to monitor the amount of data, indexes, and free space within the database, thereby indicating data volume and fragmentation (excessive fragmentation can impair performance).

sqlServerAccessMethodsEntry.name: sqlServerAccessMethodsEntry
sqlServerAccessMethodsEntry.description: Performance information for one SQL Server name instance.

sqlServerBackupDeviceTable.name: sqlServerBackupDeviceTable
sqlServerBackupDeviceTable.description: The Backup Device object provides counters to monitor Microsoft SQL Server backup devices used for backup and restore operations. Monitor backup devices when you want to determine the throughput or the progress and performance of your backup and restore operations on a per device basis. To monitor the throughput of the entire database backup or restore operation, use the Backup/Restore Throughput/sec counter of the SQL Server Databases object. For more information, see SQL Server: Databases Object.

sqlServerDatabasesTable.name: sqlServerDatabasesTable
sqlServerDatabasesTable.description: The Databases object in Microsoft SQL Server provides counters to monitor bulk copy operations, backup and restore throughput, and transaction log activities. Monitor transactions and the transaction log to determine how much user activity is occurring in the database and how full the transaction log is becoming. The amount of user activity can determine the performance of the database and affect log size, locking, and replication. Monitoring low-level log activity to gauge user activity and resource usage can help you to identify performance bottlenecks. Multiple instances of the Databases object, each representing a single database, can be monitored at the same time.

sqlServerDatabasesEntry.description: Performance information for one particular SQL Server name instance of 'Databases' object.

sqlServerLatchesTable.name: sqlServerLatchesTable
sqlServerLatchesTable.description: The Latches object in Microsoft SQL Server provides counters to monitor internal SQL Server resource locks called latches. Monitoring the latches to determine user activity and resource usage can help you to identify performance bottlenecks.

sqlServerLocksTable.name: sqlServerLocksTable
sqlServerLocksTable.description: The Locks object in Microsoft SQL Server provides information about SQL Server locks on individual resource types. Locks are held on SQL Server resources, such as rows read or modified during a transaction, to prevent concurrent use of resources by multiple transactions. For example, if an exclusive (X) lock is held on a row within a table by a transaction, no other transaction can modify that row until the lock is released. Minimizing locks increases concurrency, which can improve performance. Multiple instances of the Locks object can be monitored at the same time, with each instance representing a lock on a resource type.

sqlServerLocksEntry.name: sqlServerLocksEntry
sqlServerLocksEntry.description: Performance information for one particular SQL Server name instance of 'SQLServer:Locks' object.

sslkLockWaitTimeMs.name: sslkLockWaitTimeMs

sslkLockWaitsPerSec.name: sslkLockWaitsPerSec

sqlServerMemoryManagerTable.name: sqlServerMemoryManagerTable
sqlServerMemoryManagerTable.description: The Memory Manager object in Microsoft SQL Server provides counters to monitor overall server memory usage. Monitoring overall server memory usage to gauge user activity and resource usage can help you to identify performance bottlenecks. Monitoring the memory used by an instance of SQL Server can help determine: If bottlenecks exist due to a lack of available physical memory for storing frequently accessed data in cache. If so, SQL Server must retrieve the data from disk; If query performance can be improved by adding more memory or by making more memory available to the data cache or SQL Server internal structures.

sqlServerSQLStatisticsTable.name: sqlServerSQLStatisticsTable
sqlServerSQLStatisticsTable.description: The SQL Statistics object in Microsoft SQL Server provides counters to monitor compilation and the type of requests sent to an instance of SQL Server. Monitoring the number of query compilations and recompilations and the number of batches received by an instance of SQL Server gives you an indication of how quickly SQL Server is processing user queries and how effectively the query optimizer is processing the queries. Compilation is a significant part of a query's turnaround time. The objective of the cache is to reduce compilation by storing compiled queries for later reuse, thus eliminating the need to recompile queries when later executed. However, each unique query must be compiled at least once. Query recompilations can be caused by the following factors: Schema changes, including base schema changes such as adding columns or indexes to a table, or statistics schema changes such as inserting or deleting a significant number of rows from a table; Environment (SET statement) changes. Changes in session settings such as ANSI_PADDING or ANSI_NULLS can cause a query to be recompiled.

sqlServerUserSettableTable.name: sqlServerUserSettableTable
sqlServerUserSettableTable.description: The User Settable object in Microsoft SQL Server allows you to create custom counter instances. Use custom counter instances to monitor aspects of the server not monitored by existing counters, such as components unique to your SQL Server database (for example, the number of customer orders logged or the product inventory). The SQL Server User Settable object contains 10 instances of the query counter: User counter 1 through User counter 10. These counters map to the SQL Server stored procedures sp_user_counter1 through sp_user_counter10. As these stored procedures are executed by user applications, the values set by the stored procedures are displayed in System Monitor (Performance Monitor in Microsoft Windows NT 4.0). A counter can monitor any single integer value (for example, a stored procedure that counts how many orders for a particular product have occurred in one day). See MSDN on how to enable the counter.
